SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: 12 EDUCATIONAL AND ENTERTAINING PROGRAMS, FREE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC, WERE PRESENTED WITH A TOTAL OF 2,510 VIEWERS ENJOYING THE EVENTS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: EXPENSES NECESSARY FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF THE FOUNDATION'S PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT INCLUDING THE BUILDING AND PARKING LOT AREAS USED BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHILE ATTENDING THE LECTURES AND PERFORMING ARTS PROGRAMS BEING PRESENTED TO THE PUBLIC. HANDICAP AND ELDERLY PERSON ACCESS PROVIDED.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: PERSONNEL EXPENSES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS FOR EMPLOYEES PERFORMING SERVICES TO THE FOUNDATION TO MANAGE ITS BUSINESS AFFAIRS INCLUDING ARRANGING FOR THE PROGRAMS AND TO MEET OPERATIONAL NEEDS WHILE LECTURES AND PERFORMING ARTS ARE BEING PRESENTED TO THE PUBLIC.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: ADMINISTRATIVE AND OFFICE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FOUNDATION'S CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES FOR THE YEAR.

RlnOfActyToAccomOfExmptPrpsGrp.RelationshipStatementTxt: ENABLED THE PLANNING, SCHEDULING, AND PERFORMANCE OF EDUCATIONAL AND
ENTERTAINING PROGRAMS FOR ATTENDANCE BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC WITHOUT THE CHARGING OF ADMISSION FEES.

THE FOUNDATION'S INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO, WHICH PROVIDES ALMOST ALL OF THE FUNDS NEEDED TO CARRY OUT THE PURPOSES OF THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION IS PROFESSIONALLY MANAGED IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE A RETURN ON THE INVEST- MENTS AND TO ASSURE CONTINUED FINANCIAL OPERATING VIABILITY.
